reviews.review_msg: Took BUS430 after loving Rajiv's BUS374 — best decision ever. He's super popular and the class was full, but he still let me in so I could graduate on time. His lectures (esp the first half) were super engaging — kept me wide awake and actually interested. Amazing prof!

Rajiv totally debunked Hofstede and showed us way more nuanced ways of understanding culture — not just scores and stereotypes, but how culture actually works in real orgs. Super eye-opening. He was super supportive too — helped my friend transfer credits to graduate on time. Take this class!

Although he is very knowledgeable, he is the most unorganized prof I have ever had. Does not show up to lectures on time, does not provide instructions to assignments, does not reply to emails, and randomly changes instructions on the syllabus. That being said, he does allow AI use (he even encourages it) for online exams.

Impressively the most unorganized professor in my entire undergrad. No assignment rubriks or guidelines or examples. Very vague with instructions. He likes to contradict his syllabus sometimes (which is the only form of instructions you will get). Guy cares to an extent and is very knowledgeable, but definitely made the course harder.
He is so nice and helpful. His exams are not difficult as long as you at least skim through the assigned articles and study his slides. Would definitely recommend.

Rajiv is a great professor. He is very interested in knowing his students. His lectures cover alot of material, but if you pay attention in class you will do great. His midterms are not bad and he is always willing to help his students. I would recommend taking this class with him.

His classes are difficult but then you learn a whole lot. His classes come across as difficult because you have to read a lot of academic articles.  However, if you work hard, you will get a very nice grade. And oh yeah he is very very helpful if you go and see him personally. His accent makes him a little bit difficult to hear but its not that bad

This prof has no ability to lecture, and forces students to teach the class instead. Does not give constructive criticism, and tells students they are "bad/boring" presenters. He is absolutely useless and this class is extremely stressful. Stay away.

There is text book for the course. We had to read a lot of reseaech articles and write several reports during the course and a easy type exam. It was all very new and tough to most of us but at the end it was a very useful course... I learnt a lot about using information from research articles and got a good grade too.
